intro: Tanacetum herderi, commonly known as Herder's tansy, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, gray-green leaves and yellow button-like flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its aromatic properties make it a valuable plant in traditional herbal medicine.
